Hi James,

Is there tool that I can invoke programmatically? We are not usi=
ng
Maven. The issue is that we are working with Spring framework and in
our=
 code, we have code that wraps Spring's unchecked exceptions with
checked e=
xceptions. We used a Spring's SpringJUnit4ClassRunner before
but we can't d=
o that. Hence my question.

Thanks,

Kartik

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, =
James Abley <james.abley@...> wrote:
>
> 2009/2/23 kartik_krishnanand <kart=
ik_krishnanand@...>:
> > Hi,
> >
> > I have been using JUnit 4.x on my prev=
ious project. Now I have changed
> > companies and projects where the devel=
opment team uses JUnit 3.8. Is
> > there a test runner equivalent that I ca=
n use?
> >
> > If not, is there a way I can create something like a test ru=
nner in
> > JUNit 3.8.
> >
> > Please let me know. Any help would be apprec=
iated.
> >
> > Thanks,
> >
> > Kartik
> >
> 
> Hi,
> 
> JUnit 3.x provides =
a CLI test runner, Swing and AWT options. Most IDEs
> will also run JUnit 3=
 tests and ANT and Maven will also run them for
> you. Spoilt for choice re=
ally!
> 
> Cheers,
> 
> James
>
